question: According to India Corruption Survey 2019 conducted by Transparency International India and Local Circles ,which state leads the south India in terms of corruption?
explanation: Transparency International India (TII) and Local Circles conducted the ‘India Corruption Survey 2019’ in 20 states. With a shameful 67% of respondents of a survey conducted by Transparency International (TI) admitting to having paid bribes to accomplish work in government offices, the state of Telangana leads south India in terms of corruption this year. This is followed by Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala.
